message: Posted this on Hacker News a couple of weeks ago and got a nice response. Interested in hearing some more thoughts from people. You can sign up straight away using the invite code 'hackernews'
oh and if you experience any bugs/issues please do let me know as we're still in BETA :)
http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=2199672
Thanks man! Yeah, we're trying to.
BTW - Your web app is extremely impressive. Are you working on it full time?
No problem :)
Having to do freelance and stuff in between working on it though to survive :p
You can join straight away using the invite code 'hackernews' @jackhq
Would love for you to check out my startup, Talentopoly.com, and hear your thoughts.
I'm a user of Interstateapp. Though admittedly haven't really spent much time on the site yet. What was the link to your Hacker News article?
Just requested an invite
thanks
Just requested invite, looks interesting...
(the join page is at: http://interstateapp.com/join) :)
Thanks
Invite sent
Super impressed at the UX/aesthetics and potential of the app.  I would use it on every project if it integrated with version control or project management solutions (like Beanstalk or Lighthouse).
Looks cool. Registered for the invite. Waiting. BTW what running this site behind the curtains? framework/language etc. Just curious.
awesome, I will definitely give it a spin.... @simonify
Thanks @webster, we're looking to integrate in the near future and perhaps look in to beanstalk/lightouse integration

@mirnazim you can sign up straight away using the code 'hackernews'. Also, the site is hosted on a single MediaTemple (dv) server, we use NGiNX for our HTTP server, MongoDB for our primary datastore, PHP for the backend language (we use a custom MVC framework).
awesome @jackhq, please do share any feedback/thoughts you have r.e. the app :)

I really like the idea of being able to look at the whole picture beyond just a development task list. Im guessing that a roadmap = a product and a road = a feature, but that relationship may not be clear to noobs. It would be nice to get a how to use this screencast after first logging in. Also, I saw someone suggested "side roads" which are subtasks on a road. My $0.02 is that it over-complicates the product. Make it easy to associate a road with multiple stories in pivotal tracker (or whatever product people are using for dev) and you've solved that problem without distracting yourself from the core task which is managing the roadmap for a software product.
p.s. I'd be happy to share how we currently manage this using backpack.

@simonify Just signed up. One immediate thing that I ran into was incorrect usage of tabindex on /join–from the invite code input, tab brought me to the Company section, and then back up to Personal. Was confusing at first since I rely heavily on my keyboard.

@sudonim some sort of tutorial once you've joined is something that we're been planning for a while now and will definitely have when we publicly launch. Side roads have been a bit of a dilemma for us whether to implement them or not as we want to keep the app as simple as possible without functionality suffering. We'll hopefully have a final decision on whether to implement the feature (and how we will implement it) or not in the next few weeks.
@michaelscade sorry about the the tabindex, we switched the company/personal details sections earlier toady and updating the tabindex must have slipped our minds. We'll get this issue fixed now.
*we've been planning
hey josh! glad you guys are liking it :)
we
we've been using it internally, and i love how lightweight it feels

What would you guys think if we made side roads entirely optional? Therefore a road would still work independently until you've added a side road, which would allow you to continue using Interstate as it is whilst others who need side roads have the ability to make them.
